name: Massada Guest House

reviews.text: I stayed in Massada Youth hostel for one night in march 2008. This hostel is freshly renovated just some month ago. A very nice place, the rooms are clean and equipped with big bathroom, water boiler, fridge, air con and three-chanel-TV. The food is tasty, there´s no snackbar or something around, so you have to eat dinner in the hostel. You have internet access to moderate prices. Staff at the reception is very friendly, provides you with bus plans and packed breakfast if you ask for it. Unfortunately the huge swimming pool in the garden is not used, at least in the moment.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

likes.disliked: — swimming pool is not in use

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night in September 2011 with my husband en route from Jerusalem to Eilat. I chose the property based on its proximity to Massada, which is about a two minute walk from the front door of the hostel. Check in was very easy and we were allowed to check in early which I appreciated. You can pay in either shekels or dollars but the rate they charge is in dollars if you book on the internet. The property itself is really stunning. It looks more like a hotel than a hostel. The grounds are very nice and expansive. There's a great deck that overlooks the Dead Sea which is a great place to hang out at during the evening. The only thing that actually makes this a hostel is the rooms, which are bare bones and no frills, though very clean. Our room had a tv, air con, beautiful view of the Dead Sea, 2 beds plus a bunk bed, a mini fridge, small table and separate toilet and shower stall in the bathroom. The beds were comfortable enough, but certainly not luxurious. We didn't use the pool since it closes rather early, but it looked very nice. The breakfast was really a treat; a plentiful buffet of eggs, hummus, salad, breads, cereal, fruit and a variety of beverages. The property also has a small snack bar that sells popcicles, ice cream and other treats, but other than that there is no food available for purchase anywhere near the property. Unless you have a car, this isn't the most easily accessed hostel. We had a rental car and found the drive into the resort area to take about 15 minutes. There's plenty of food and shopping in that area as well as the best beach for soaking in the Dead Sea. The front desk staff was very friendly and super informative and told us the best time to wake up to hike to Massada. We woke up a little late so in an effort to see the sunrise, we did a pretty brisk hike up the mountain which took about 35-40 minutes. If you're in good shape, it won't take you an hour to do the hike. If your objective is to experience the splendor of Massada, you should definitely stay here. It's also the cheapest place to stay in the Dead Sea and a tremendously good value at $100/night, including breakfast.
reviews.title: Nicest Hostel I've Stayed In

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hostel is right at the base of Massada. It's the only place to stay that is within walking distance of Massada. There are no restaurants within walking distance of the hostel, except for the restaurant at the hostel (open for breakfast and usually open for dinner), and the restaurant at the Massada visitors' center (open for lunch). The food was served buffet-style, and was reasonably good. The exterior of the hostel was beautiful, and the rooms were not bad for a hostel.
reviews.title: Good value right at the base of Massada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location - at the base of Masada - is great if you're walking up for sunrise, but this place is seriously institutional and the staff are very unhelpful.
reviews.title: The only reason you'd stay here is to ensure you see sunrise from the top of Masada

reviews.text: The rooms are a decent size but are totally lacking character. They even have large balconies but with no furniture to sit on to enjoy them!
reviews.title: More like a beautiful hotel than a hostel

reviews.title: Only accommodation in Massada
Great location, bad food
reviews.text: Massada guest house / youth hostel is a good place to stay, if you know what to expect. The location is great and somebody clearly invested a lot of money in this hostel. And for a youth hostel it is very clean.

The problem with it is the food. The arab kitchen staff puts obviously as little effort in it as possible. It is really bad and the staff observed those stupid enough to have paid 55 schekel for that rubbish with a certain sarcastic smile as if they themselves cannot believe somebody actually eats that junk. And there is litterally no shop anywhere, so make shure to bring a lot of food when you stay here. There is a fridge in the room so make use of it.
reviews.title: Great value at the base of Massada

reviews.text: Also don't expect to be able to sleep before one o'clock in the night - it's a youth hostel and the teenies don't get tired early.
reviews.title: Modern, clean and ideal for an early climb

reviews.text: Also it is disappointing , that they close the pool at 5 when one usually returns from a trip.
reviews.title: Let us down really badly - be careful about trusting their booking system
